name: zstd

variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

variants.name: generator
variants.description: the build system generator to use

variants.name: libs
variants.description: Build shared libs, static libs or both

variants.name: compression
variants.description: Enable support for additional compression methods in programs

description:
Zstandard, or zstd as short version, is a fast lossless compression
algorithm, targeting real-time compression scenarios at zlib-level and
better compression ratios.

dependencies.name: cmake
dependencies.description:
A cross-platform, open-source build system. CMake is a family of tools
designed to build, test and package software.

dependencies.name: gmake
dependencies.description:
GNU Make is a tool which controls the generation of executables and
other non-source files of a program from the program's source files.

dependencies.name: ninja
dependencies.description:
Ninja is a small build system with a focus on speed. It differs from
other build systems in two major respects: it is designed to have its
input files generated by a higher-level build system, and it is designed
to run builds as fast as possible.

dependencies.name: zlib
dependencies.description:
A free, general-purpose, legally unencumbered lossless data-compression
library.

dependencies.name: lz4
dependencies.description:
LZ4 is lossless compression algorithm, providing compression speed at
400 MB/s per core, scalable with multi-cores CPU. It also features an
extremely fast decoder, with speed in multiple GB/s per core, typically
reaching RAM speed limits on multi-core systems.

dependencies.name: xz
dependencies.description:
XZ Utils is free general-purpose data compression software with high
compression ratio. XZ Utils were written for POSIX-like systems, but
also work on some not-so-POSIX systems. XZ Utils are the successor to
LZMA Utils.

dependent_to.name: librdkafka
dependent_to.description: librdkafka is a C library implementation of the Apache Kafka protocol.

dependent_to.name: r-rhdf5filters
dependent_to.description:
HDF5 Compression Filters. Provides a collection of compression filters
for use with HDF5 datasets.

dependent_to.name: libpulsar
dependent_to.description:
libpulsar is a C/C++ client library implementation of the Apache Pulsar
protocol.

dependent_to.name: file
dependent_to.description:
The file command is "a file type guesser", that is, a command-line tool
that tells you in words what kind of data a file contains

dependent_to.name: qcat
dependent_to.description: Quick data compression quality analysis tool

dependent_to.name: py-uproot
dependent_to.description:
ROOT I/O in pure Python and NumPy. Uproot is a reader and a writer of
the ROOT file format using only Python and Numpy. Unlike the standard
C++ ROOT implementation, Uproot is only an I/O library, primarily
intended to stream data into machine learning libraries in Python.
Unlike PyROOT and root_numpy, Uproot does not depend on C++ ROOT.
Instead, it uses Numpy to cast blocks of data from the ROOT file as
Numpy arrays.

dependent_to.name: binutils
dependent_to.description: GNU binutils, which contain the linker, assembler, objdump and others

dependent_to.name: gcc
dependent_to.description:
The GNU Compiler Collection includes front ends for C, C++, Objective-C,
Fortran, Ada, and Go, as well as libraries for these languages.

dependent_to.name: boost
dependent_to.description:
Boost provides free peer-reviewed portable C++ source libraries,
emphasizing libraries that work well with the C++ Standard Library.
Boost libraries are intended to be widely useful, and usable across a
broad spectrum of applications. The Boost license encourages both
commercial and non-commercial use.

dependent_to.name: mgard
dependent_to.description:
MGARD error bounded lossy compressor forked from
https://github.com/CODARcode/MGARD with patches to support Spack

dependent_to.name: rocksdb
dependent_to.description: RocksDB: A Persistent Key-Value Store for Flash and RAM Storage

dependent_to.name: szauto
dependent_to.description:
SZauto: SZ C++ Version that Supports Second-Order Prediction and
Parameter Optimization

dependent_to.name: spack
dependent_to.description:
Spack is a multi-platform package manager that builds and installs
multiple versions and configurations of software. It works on Linux,
macOS, and many supercomputers. Spack is non-destructive: installing a
new version of a package does not break existing installations, so many
configurations of the same package can coexist.

dependent_to.name: orca
dependent_to.description:
An ab initio, DFT and semiempirical SCF-MO package Note: Orca is
licensed software. You will need to create an account on the Orca
homepage and download Orca yourself. Spack will search your current
directory for the download file. Alternatively, add this file to a
mirror so that Spack can find it. For instructions on how to set up a
mirror, see https://spack.readthedocs.io/en/latest/mirrors.html

dependent_to.name: rsync
dependent_to.description: An open source utility that provides fast incremental file transfer.

dependent_to.name: c-blosc2
dependent_to.description:
Next generation c-blosc with a new API, a new container and other bells
and whistles

dependent_to.name: tar
dependent_to.description:
GNU Tar provides the ability to create tar archives, as well as various
other kinds of manipulation.

dependent_to.name: sz-cpp
dependent_to.description: Refactorization of SZ in cpp

dependent_to.name: sz3
dependent_to.description: SZ3 is the next generation of the SZ compressor framework

dependent_to.name: wiredtiger
dependent_to.description:
WiredTiger is an high performance, scalable, production quality, NoSQL,
Open Source extensible platform for data management.

dependent_to.name: libtiff
dependent_to.description: LibTIFF - Tag Image File Format (TIFF) Library and Utilities.

dependent_to.name: libarchive
dependent_to.description:
libarchive: C library and command-line tools for reading and writing
tar, cpio, zip, ISO, and other archive formats.

dependent_to.name: gcta
dependent_to.description:
GCTA (Genome-wide Complex Trait Analysis) was originally designed to
estimate the proportion of phenotypic variance explained by all genome-
wide SNPs for complex traits (the GREML method), and has subsequently
extended for many other analyses to better understand the genetic
architecture of complex traits. GCTA currently supports the following
analyses.

dependent_to.name: llvm
dependent_to.description:
The LLVM Project is a collection of modular and reusable compiler and
toolchain technologies. Despite its name, LLVM has little to do with
traditional virtual machines, though it does provide helpful libraries
that can be used to build them. The name "LLVM" itself is not an
acronym; it is the full name of the project.

dependent_to.name: root
dependent_to.description: ROOT is a data analysis framework.

dependent_to.name: orc
dependent_to.description: the smallest, fastest columnar storage for Hadoop workloads.

dependent_to.name: py-imagecodecs
dependent_to.description:
Imagecodecs is a Python library that provides block-oriented, in-memory
buffer transformation, compression, and decompression functions for use
in the tifffile, czifile, zarr, and other scientific image input/output
modules..

dependent_to.name: qt
dependent_to.description: Qt is a comprehensive cross-platform C++ application framework.

dependent_to.name: squashfs
dependent_to.description: Squashfs - read only compressed filesystem

dependent_to.name: sperr
dependent_to.description:
SPERR is a lossy scientific (floating-point) data compressor that can
perform either error-bounded or size-bounded data compression

dependent_to.name: gmic
dependent_to.description:
G'MIC is an open-source framework for digital image processing. G'MIC is
a full-featured open-source framework for digital image processing,
distributed under the CeCILL free software licenses (LGPL-like and/or
GPL-compatible). It provides several user interfaces to convert /
process / visualize generic image datasets, ranging from 1D scalar
signals to 3D+t sequences of multi-spectral volumetric images, hence
including 2D color images.

dependent_to.name: c-blosc
dependent_to.description: Blosc, an extremely fast, multi-threaded, meta-compressor library

dependent_to.name: qt-base
dependent_to.description: Qt Base (Core, Gui, Widgets, Network, ...)

dependent_to.name: elfutils
dependent_to.description:
elfutils is a collection of various binary tools such as eu-objdump, eu-
readelf, and other utilities that allow you to inspect and manipulate
ELF files. Refer to Table 5.Tools Included in elfutils for Red Hat
Developer for a complete list of binary tools that are distributed with
the Red Hat Developer Toolset version of elfutils.

dependent_to.name: mmseqs2
dependent_to.description:
MMseqs2 (Many-against-Many sequence searching) is a software suite to
search and cluster huge protein and nucleotide sequence sets

dependent_to.name: goshimmer
dependent_to.description:
GoShimmer is a prototype node for exploring the implementation of IOTA
2.0

dependent_to.name: gdal
dependent_to.description:
GDAL: Geospatial Data Abstraction Library. GDAL is a translator library
for raster and vector geospatial data formats that is released under an
MIT style Open Source License by the Open Source Geospatial Foundation.
As a library, it presents a single raster abstract data model and single
vector abstract data model to the calling application for all supported
formats. It also comes with a variety of useful command line utilities
for data translation and processing.

dependent_to.name: qoz
dependent_to.description:
Quality optimized version of SZ3 is the next generation of the SZ
compressor framework

dependent_to.name: mongo-c-driver
dependent_to.description: libmongoc is a client library written in C for MongoDB.

dependent_to.name: rpm
dependent_to.description:
The RPM package manager https://github.com/rpm-software-
management/rpm/blob/master/INSTALL Note that debugedit is an additional
tool that *should* compile with adding libdw and elfutils, but the
library (as of 4.16.1.2) is being removed from rpm and will be put
somewhere else.

dependent_to.name: r-qs
dependent_to.description:
Quick Serialization of R Objects. Provides functions for quickly writing
and reading any R object to and from disk.

dependent_to.name: heaptrack
dependent_to.description:
Heaptrack is a heap memory profiler that traces all memory allocations
and annotates these events with stack traces.

dependent_to.name: ncl
dependent_to.description:
NCL is an interpreted language designed specifically for scientific data
analysis and visualization. Supports NetCDF 3/4, GRIB 1/2, HDF 4/5, HDF-
EOD 2/5, shapefile, ASCII, binary. Numerous analysis functions are
built-in.

dependent_to.name: plink-ng
dependent_to.description: A comprehensive update to the PLINK association analysis toolset.

dependent_to.name: plink2
dependent_to.description:
PLINK2: Whole genome association analysis toolset, designed to perform a
range of basic, large-scale analyses in a computationally efficient
manner.

dependent_to.name: mgardx
dependent_to.description:
MGARD implementation for research purposes forked from:
https://github.com/lxAltria/MGARDx

dependent_to.name: arrow
dependent_to.description:
A cross-language development platform for in-memory data. This package
contains the C++ bindings.

dependent_to.name: tkrzw
dependent_to.description:
Tkrzw is a C++ library implementing database managers with various
algorithms.

dependent_to.name: micromamba
dependent_to.description:
Mamba is a fast, robust, and cross-platform package manager (Miniconda
alternative). Micromamba is faster than Miniconda, and it is a
standalone executable, whereas Miniconda pulls in its own Python
environment.

dependent_to.name: ncbi-rmblastn
dependent_to.description: RMBlast search engine for NCBI

dependent_to.name: squashfuse
dependent_to.description: squashfuse - Mount SquashFS archives using FUSE

dependent_to.name: ccache
dependent_to.description:
ccache is a compiler cache. It speeds up recompilation by caching
previous compilations and detecting when the same compilation is being
done again.

dependent_to.name: grass
dependent_to.description:
GRASS GIS (Geographic Resources Analysis Support System), is a free and
open source Geographic Information System (GIS) software suite used for
geospatial data management and analysis, image processing, graphics and
maps production, spatial modeling, and visualization.

dependent_to.name: qgis
dependent_to.description:
QGIS is a free and open-source cross-platform desktop geographic
information system application that supports viewing, editing, and
analysis of geospatial data.

dependent_to.name: netcdf-c
dependent_to.description:
NetCDF (network Common Data Form) is a set of software libraries and
machine-independent data formats that support the creation, access, and
sharing of array-oriented scientific data. This is the C distribution.

dependent_to.name: sz
dependent_to.description: Error-bounded Lossy Compressor for HPC Data

dependent_to.name: gdb
dependent_to.description:
GDB, the GNU Project debugger, allows you to see what is going on
'inside' another program while it executes -- or what another program
was doing at the moment it crashed.
